snippet: On Sunday, we'll see if the Grammy Awards shake out like the 2011 album sales charts - as a race for second behind Adele and her album, "21."
abstract: On Sunday, we'll see if the Grammy Awards shake out like the 2011 album sales charts - as a race for second behind Adele and her album, "21."
lead_paragraph: The Grammy Awards could end up much like the 2011 album sales charts did - as a race for second behind Adele and her top-selling album, "21" (XL/Columbia). This British belter, a critical favorite and seller of more than 7.5 million records (hard copies and digital) in the United States alone last year, will surprise almost no one if she sweeps the big awards on Sunday, including Album, Record, Song and Artist of the Year. She is also doubling as perhaps the most anticipated young performer at the Feb. 12 Grammy ceremony, to be broadcast on CBS. That is, depending on how you feel about Chris Brown.

headline.main: The Grammys: Does Anyone Stand a Chance Against Adele?
